interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Perry Mason: Season 1, Vol. 1 Review Date: 2014/05/13 Store: Raymond Burr (Actor), Barbara Hale (Actor), Robert Ellis Miller (Director), Ted Post (Director) & 1 more Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Mystery & Thrillers Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Perry Mason is an attorney who specializes in defending seemingly indefensible cases. With the aid of his secretary Della Street and investigator Paul Drake, he often finds that by digging deeply into the facts, startling facts can be revealed. Often relying on his outstanding courtroom skills, he often tricks or traps people into unwittingly admitting their guilt. Steps to access the closed-captioning is as follows: 1. Press SETTINGS on your remote. 2. Using the left/right arrow buttons, scroll to Quick Settings. 3. Using the up/down arrow buttons, scroll to Closed Captioning. 4. Press SELECT on your remote. 5. Using the up/down arrow buttons, scroll to highlight On, On with Mute or Off. 6. Press SELECT on your remote.', 'Amazon.com', 'There was a time when the defense attorney was a heroic everyman, not the butt of bad jokes; think Atticus Finch in', 'To Kill a Mockingbird', ", and, of course, Raymond Burr's incomparable Perry Mason. The first season of", 'Perry Mason', ', which launched in 1957 on CBS, shows just how dramatic a "law and order" show could be. Shot in lush black and white, on film, the episodes have been lovingly restored (including lost minutes hacked from reruns to accommodate commercials). The story arcs and atmosphere feel more like film noir (Perry Mason + Philip Marlowe = separated at birth?) than early TV. The cast was stellar, including Burr\'s Emmy-winning Perry Mason, the indefatigable lawyer who takes tough cases no one else will touch. Burr\'s chemistry crackles from episode 1 with his costars, including Barbara Hale as secretary Della, William Hopper as private detective Paul Drake, and William Talman as Hamilton Burger, the well-meaning but overmatched district attorney. While it\'s true that the last-minute witness-stand confessions strain some credulity, the case-cracking, character development, and dialogue set a high bar for the legal shows that followed. "The Case of the Negligent Nymph," for instance, involves a comely young woman--and murder suspect--fished out of the Pacific; Mason deadpans to Drake, "Call off the search, Paul; we\'ve landed our mermaid." The shows unfold at a leisurely pace, and yet don\'t rely on the overly expositive dialogue that, say,', 'Law & Order', "does; the viewer learns a lot about each case simply as it happens. The set contains the first 19 episodes of the first season and will hook you, even if you're not a procedural buff.", '--A.T. Hurley'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Television, Television/Crime', 'Format': 'Closed-captioned, NTSC, Full Screen, Black & White, Multiple Formats, Box set', 'Contributor': 'Gerald Mayer, John Peyser, Roger Kay, James Goldstone, Ted Post, Francis D. Lyon, Robert Ellis Miller, Raymond Burr, Barbara Hale, Don Weis, Jerry Hopper, William Talman, Jack Arnold, William Hopper, John English, Richard Whorf, Gilbert KayGerald Mayer, John Peyser, Roger Kay, James Goldstone, Ted Post, Francis D. Lyon, Robert Ellis Miller, Raymond Burr, Barbara Hale, Don Weis, Jerry Hopper, William Talman, Jack Arnold, William Hopper, John English, Richard Whorf, Gilbert Kay See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 1.0)', 'Number Of Discs': '5', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.91 x 5.44 x 7.8 inches; 9.59 Ounces', 'Item model number': '097368878143', 'Director': 'Robert Ellis Miller, Ted Post, James Goldstone, Jack Arnold, Don Weis', 'Media Format': 'Closed-captioned, NTSC, Full Screen, Black & White, Multiple Formats, Box set', 'Run time': '1 hour', 'Release date': 'July 11, 2006', 'Actors': 'Raymond Burr, Barbara Hale, William Talman, William Hopper', 'Studio': 'Paramount/CBS', 'Number of discs': '5'} Review Text: I am a any time fan of perry mason
murder,mystery, intrigue, excitement,keeps me guessing
all through the courtroom drama fascinated with the
actors that play the rolls.
Enjoyable! Review Title: perry mason, season 1,vol l Rating: 4.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Murder, She Wrote: Season 2 Angela Lansbury (Actor), Tom Bosley (Actor) Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Universal Studios Home Entertainment, All Universal Studios Titles ['Emmy Award nominee Angela Lansbury is back on the case in all 22 episodes of the critically acclaimed series, Murder, She Wrote Season Two. Rejoin Jessica Fletcher, everyone\'s favorite mystery writer, back in Cabot Cove, where she pens her whodunit books and keeps finding that her life is imitating her art. Teamed with some of the biggest guest stars on television, including Jerry Orbach, Adrienne Barbeau, Dick Van Patten and Carol Lawrence, Jessica continues her quest to find the truth in even the murkiest circumstances. Catch the complete second season of Murder, She Wrote, the classic mystery series that "…remains well worth revisiting two decades later" (Josef Adalian, Daily Variety).'] {'Genre': 'Drama, Television, DVD Movie, Blu-ray Movie, Mystery & Suspense', 'Format': 'Box set, Color, Dolby, Full Screen', 'Contributor': 'William Windom, Tom Bosley, Angela Lansbury', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono), Unqualified', 'Number Of Discs': '3', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Package Dimensions': '7.72 x 6.02 x 1.89 inches; 8.8 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'Box set, Color, Dolby, Full Screen', 'Run time': '35 hours and 28 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 6, 2005', 'Actors': 'Angela Lansbury, Tom Bosley, William Windom', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Universal Studios Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '3'} enjoy watching crime stopper with mrs. fletcher

profile:
The user continues to showcase a strong affinity for the mystery genre, particularly classic television series featuring courtroom drama and crime-solving narratives. Their recent interaction highlights a keen interest in character-driven stories and iconic figures in the legal and detective realms, emphasizing their admiration for performances by established actors. The user appreciates engaging and suspenseful plots that maintain a sense of intrigue and excitement, consistent with their previous preferences for high-quality storytelling and character development.

The user's positive response, as indicated by their favorable rating, suggests a strong emotional connection to the themes of murder, mystery, and intrigue. This aligns well with their overall passion for classic series, as they enjoy revisiting iconic shows that have stood the test of time. Additionally, their preference for physical media formats like DVD box sets signifies a desire for complete collections and collectible items rather than relying solely on streaming. This commitment to tangible media further underscores their appreciation for nostalgia and the craftsmanship of classic television. Overall, the user remains dedicated to exploring and enjoying classic mystery narratives, particularly those that feature compelling characters and immersive storytelling.
